question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Compute $\begin{pmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 7 & -1 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & -5 \\ 0 & 4 \end{pmatrix}.$
inference:
Solution:
To multiply matrices, we multiply the rows of the first matrix by the columns of the second matrix. 

The first entry of the product matrix is given by $(2)(1) + (3)(0) = 2$.

The second entry of the first row is given by $(2)(-5) + (3)(4) = 2$.

The first entry of the second row is given by $(7)(1) + (-1)(0) = 7$.

The second entry of the second row is given by $(7)(-5) + (-1)(4) = -39$.

Putting this all together, we have 
\[\begin{pmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 7 & -1 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & -5 \\ 0 & 4 \end{pmatrix} = \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 2 & 2 \\ 7 & -39 \end{pmatrix}}.\]Final Answer: $\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 2 & 2 \\ 7 & -39 \end{pmatrix}}$. I hope it is correct.
